title: The Black Shadow
opening: A mysterious group seems hell-bent on capturing Nils and Ninian... Having failed, this group, the Black Fang, flees. Rumor has them traveling southwest. Lyn and her colleagues follow in hopes of recovering a lost heirloom. The Black Fang have made a stronghold of an abandoned castle in Khathelet. Its dark halls are alive with shadowy figures...

intro.speaker: Ursula
intro.line: So the brother escaped, and the sister was rescued by a band of strangers. Do I understand you?

intro.speaker: Beyard
intro.line: Yes... They ambushed us, and...

intro.speaker: Ursula
intro.line: Hold your excuses. The end is all that matters.

intro.speaker: Beyard
intro.line: Yes, ma'am.

intro.speaker: Ursula
intro.line: And your plan for recovering the siblings is?

intro.speaker: Beyard
intro.line: We've word the entire group is heading this way, with the brats in tow.

intro.speaker: Ursula
intro.line: They're coming here? Why would they do that?

intro.speaker: Beyard
intro.line: They may well be after this ring... It's a rare piece. We took it from the girl. It was a stroke of luck that we did, especially if it brings them to us now. I'll grab the whole lot of 'em with this to bait the trap.

intro.speaker: Ursula
intro.line: I see... Very well, I'll give you another chance. I've business elsewhere, but I shall return once it's finished. You have until sunrise tomorrow. Do you understand?

intro.speaker: Beyard
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Ursula
intro.line: If you do not have the children when I return...my hand will deal you the fang's punishment. Remember that. Bear it closely in your mind.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I believe they went in there.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Milady, are you really going in there to get the ring back?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Yes, we are.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: But this is their stronghold! They're bound to be well defended, not to mention well armed!

intro.speaker: Ninian
intro.line: Please forget about the ring. It's OK...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Tactician's agreed to attempt this...recovery. I wouldn't be here if not for that. Tactician believes we can do this, and I'm sure that decision was not made lightly. With Tactician at my side, I'm confident we can win. Let's get you ring back, Ninian.

intro.speaker: Nils
intro.line: Milady...

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Milady Lyndis! There are more of the foe inside than we thought.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: This is their stronghold. It's imperative we move carefully.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Exactly, milady. This narrow corridor can be used to our advantage. If we draw the enemy through here, we can engage them in small numbers and remain relatively safe. If time is a concern, we can always rush them... If we do that, we'd better be sure we can win.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: So, Tactician. What do you think? How we move forward is completely up to you.

battle.speaker: Beyard
battle.line: How? This can't be... They should be dead! Everyone, get in there and finish them! This is our final chance!

boss.speaker: Beyard
boss.line: I musn't fail. I cannot fail. The consequences are too--

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Give us the ring! And swear us this oath... You must promise to leave these two alone. If I have your vow, I'll spare your life...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What?! Poison? He took his own life...

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: These are no common brigands we're dealing with. This man was trained by a well-organized group.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What do they want with Nils and Ninian?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Nils, Ninian. Everything's going to be fine. As long as you're with us, you'll be safe.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: You witnessed our victory, right? With Tactician's planning and my sword, you've no worries. If we all work together, there's nothing we can't overcome. I don't care who comes after you; I'll not let you be taken.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes, on my honor. Right, Tactician?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: You called it Nini's Grace, did you not? That lout had it.

end.speaker: Nils
end.line: Milady Lyndis! Thank you so much!

end.speaker: Ninian
end.line: I have no other words, save thank you.
